SEARCH
Package com.unifiedcontainermanager.Core

Interface ContainerManager

All Known Subinterfaces:
ContainerToolStrategy
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCliStrategy, BuildahStrategy, ContainerService, DockerStrategy, PodmanStrategy
public interface ContainerManager

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    CompletableFuture<String>
    createContainer(ContainerConfig config)
    Creates a new container based on the provided configuration.
    CompletableFuture<Void>

  • Method Details

    • createContainer

      CompletableFuture<String> createContainer(ContainerConfig config) throws ContainerManagerException
      Creates a new container based on the provided configuration.
      Parameters:
      config - The configuration for the new container.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture holding the ID of the created container.
      Throws:
      ContainerManagerException - if creation fails.

    • startContainer

      CompletableFuture<Void> startContainer(String containerId) throws ContainerManagerException
      Starts an existing container.
      Parameters:
      containerId - The ID of the container to start.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the start command is issued.
      Throws:
      ContainerManagerException - if starting fails.

    • stopContainer

      CompletableFuture<Void> stopContainer(String containerId, Integer timeoutSeconds) throws ContainerManagerException
      Stops a running container.
      Parameters:
      containerId - The ID of the container to stop.
      timeoutSeconds - Optional timeout in seconds to wait before killing the container. Null for default.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the stop command is issued.
      Throws:
      ContainerManagerException - if stopping fails.

    • removeContainer

      CompletableFuture<Void> removeContainer(String containerId, boolean force, boolean removeVolumes) throws ContainerManagerException
      Removes a container. The container should typically be stopped first.
      Parameters:
      containerId - The ID of the container to remove.
      force - If true, forcefully remove the container (e.g., if it's running).
      removeVolumes - If true, remove anonymous volumes associated with the container.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the remove command is issued.
      Throws:
      ContainerManagerException - if removal fails.

    • listContainers

      CompletableFuture<List<ContainerInfo>> listContainers(boolean listAll) throws ContainerManagerException
      Lists containers.
      Parameters:
      listAll - If true, lists all containers (including stopped ones). Otherwise, lists only running containers.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture holding a list of ContainerInfo objects.
      Throws:
      ContainerManagerException - if listing fails.

    • getContainerLogs

      CompletableFuture<Void> getContainerLogs(String containerId, LogOptions options, Consumer<String> logConsumer) throws ContainerManagerException
      Retrieves logs from a container.
      Parameters:
      containerId - The ID of the container.
      options - Options for fetching logs (e.g., follow, tail).
      logConsumer - A consumer that will receive log lines as they are emitted. For non-following logs, this might be called multiple times until all logs are delivered. For following logs, this will be called continuously.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the log streaming setup is done (for follow) or all logs are fetched.
      Throws:
      ContainerManagerException - if fetching logs fails.

    • inspectContainer

      CompletableFuture<ContainerInfo> inspectContainer(String containerIdOrName) throws ContainerManagerException
      Inspects a container and returns detailed information.
      Parameters:
      containerIdOrName - The ID or name of the container to inspect.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture holding the ContainerInfo object.
      Throws:
      ContainerManagerException - if inspection fails or container not found.
